atlantis.wxgui.hexmap¶

Hex map canvas.

Most important part of an Atlantis PBEM client is the map. Actually you could develop a Atlantis PBEM helper that does only show a map, while any other action can be done using a text editor.

This module defines an HexMapWindow class that implements a wxPython ScrolledCanvas that shows an hexagonal map.

HexMapWindow won’t hold map data on his own, but will define instead an interface that must to be implemented by map controllers.

Public classes in atlantis.wxgui.hexmap module:

HexMapWindow Hex map canvas.

HexMapWindow¶

class atlantis.wxgui.hexmap.HexMapWindow(*args, **kwargs)¶

Hex map canvas.

Implements a wx.ScrolledCanvas that shows an hex-based map.

Defined constants: - Zoom values:

  • ZOOM_25: zooms the map at 25% size.
  • ZOOM_50: zooms the map at 50% size.
  • ZOOM_75: zooms the map at 75% size.
  • ZOOM_100: zooms the map at 100% (normal) size.
  • ZOOM_150: zooms the map at 150% size.
  • ZOOM_200: zooms the map at 200% size.
  • ZOOM_OUT: equivalent to ZOOM_25.
  • ZOOM_IN: equivalent to ZOOM_200.
add_terrain_type(terrain_type, brush)¶

Adds a new terrain type to the map.

Each hexagon of the given terrain_type will be drawn with the give background for this type. Whether terrain_type existed its information is overwritten.

Parameters:
  • terrain_type – terrain type added to the map.
  • brush – wx.Brush used to draw the hex.
delete_terrain_type(terrain_type)¶

Delete a terrain type from the map.

Drop this terrain type information from HexMapWindow.

Parameters:terrain_type – terrain type to be deleted.
Raises KeyError:
 if terrain type does not exist.
clear_terrain_types()¶

Deletes terrain types information.

set_map_data(map_data)¶

Set map data to be shown in by HexMapWindow.

This map data has to be a list of hexes, where each hex is an HexMapData.

After setting map_data HexMapWindow is forced to redraw with the new data.

Parameters:map_data – list of HexMapData.
set_zoom(zoom)¶

Set map zoom.
